Replies.Reply: Yes, gentleman can I help you?
Peter, Doc Ock wants to see you.
I better get out of here.
Whoa, doc! You look a little messed up yourself.
I went after the kid. You still want that Parker guy's data, don't you?
I saw you crushing the Crusher.
I'm going to the Masquerade. It's Halloween tonight Doc, aren't you coming to the School Ball? Whoa, you could go without an outfit.
Cost you a thousand bucks, if I get it.
All I want it the kid's computer crap!
You're my ticket outa here. Gimme that stupid mask!
Get me out of this madhouse!
The anti-force experiment has now reached the limit of electronic overload safety.
Gentlemen, come, you must see this.
Thorkel you are the dummiest administrator our university has ever had.
I am going for 20 percent power!
Can we carry on Mr. Thorkel.
I have no time for forms, or administrators who persist in interrupting me, Mr. Thorkel.
Then shut up! And pay some attention to the experiment.
Now that's what I call an experiment!
would flow into each other. No blue universe. No yellow. End, finished, over.
Now you take the Planetary Conjunction.
I want to see that data, Peter!
Well, I'm certain something can be worked out. Run along, young man.
Weiner! Go get me that boy's data!
Just get it. We'll negotiate your fee when you have the data, alright Weiner?
You're denying me access to my cyclotron?!
Weiner, go outside and get us something to eat. And don't steal it! Just buy it.
Noble Shmoble, I am going for a much bigger prize kid. Okey, dokey. Let me show you, kid, what I got here.
It's an energy storm! Okey! Dokey!
Destiny!!! My destiny! I see it all so clearly now. Universal destruction, yes.
What a wreck. What a useless, wasted wreck. Okey, dokey. We rebuild you, my damaged darling. Bigger, better, hotter!
Where have you been, you imbecile?
Will I beat him, this Crusher, will I beat him or not?
What do you think you're doing?
You're not going to any ball, clown.
I don't care if you come back dead. Just get it!
You wouldn't lie to your Professor now, would you?
He's a nice boy. A little nerdy maybe, but nice, wouldn't you say?
Let her go? What an excellent idea. If you do not deliver your friend, Mr.
I am thinking, insect. I'm thinking about exterminating you!
Now I must kill you, you cretinous clown.
Once I dispose of you, Spider-Man, no one will be able to stop me.
That's Professor Octopus to you Spider Jerk!
We are new inserting Peter Parker's data on tonight's Planetary Conjunction.
Yes, yes! Go on! Go on!
I knew it. I knew it! Universal destruction! It's doable! I am putting a countdown clock on the Planetary Conjunction now!
Okey, dokey. Now let's see if I have enough power to drive this beast.
You're a doomed bug, Wall Crawler. I've no time to waste on you now.
So you've avoided the nuclear pool, have you, Spider-Man?
But, they won't help me. Everybody is trying to destroy my experiment. And so are you, Rosomorf.
Help me with these drums, I need to get them to my laboratory immediately.
Drive, Flash, before I flush your girl right down the toilet!
Aha! You never included the Conjunction in your calculations, did you?! Rosomorf!
A new world waits! Rosomorf! It is my destiny!!!
Other worlds, Roz, other times, other dimensions, who knows? Who cares?
Truth, Rosomorf. Look at it! The new truth! The new way!
No, you don't listen to that clown, he can't save you, or the world for that matter.
Oh, why don't you grow up.
That sounds like a scenario for the end of the world.
And besides, he's not all bad.
Give it up, Parker. You'd die for a nickname like Flash.
We're going to the Student Reunion Meeting. You coming?
It's not what you said, it's how you say it, ShooShoo!
Could anyone be in there, Peter?
Will you two shush. I'm trying to work.
Hiya, Peter. Who is in the Spider-Man costume?
Hey, Peter! These are your pictures!
It says here "Photos by Peter Parker."
What were you doing in here?
Oh, I don't know. Maybe. He's very inexperienced.
Put me down, you mechanical mutant!
What do you think you're doing?
Wait a minute. Where are you taking me?
Okay, put me down and we can talk, alright?
There's someone I like, but he's too shy to notice.
How'd you know this was Flash's place?
Peter told you all about Flash?
Thank you. He really wanted so badly to come see you. He called me up out of the blue.
He's in there. I know Peter is in there.
Where's Peter? He must be here somewhere.
But what about Peter? We've got to find Peter!
What am I supposed to do with this!
I knew you were going to say that.
I just adore confidence in a man.
What is it you say when you jump?
We have a lot to thank your friend Spider-Man for.
This may be the end of a beautiful friendship you know?
Ock is a genius, Harry. Crazy, Yes! But, a genius misunderstood, and unappreciated.
Our hero has a real way with words.
You don't get nicknamed Flash because you're a rocket scientist, Liz.
He knows about my work on the Planetary Conjunction, doesn't he?
Yes sir, I've worked out a new way to calculate the combined gravitational effect.
There's nothing in there worth stealing!
Sorry, Professor, I can't do it. I gave my word to Professor Rosomorf.
Mr. Jameson! What are you doing here?
How do you know I'll show up?
I was bitten by a bug.
And I love you too, Aunt May.
And by the way, I got a mess of super powers today.
How does it look? I feel like it's Halloween.
Doesn't he look amazing in that one?
I bet I know who it is.
It's a very clever outfit you've got there, Flash.
Cleaning up. Come on. I'll get your computer. Where's Flash parked?
Hey! Can I get a lift downtown?
I gotta remember to have that fixed.
There you are, I've been looking for you all over town.
We have to find out, sit down.
I want to access Dr. Octavius' main program. I want to know about his experiments with the cyclotron. Can you do it?
Mr. Jameson, you got me at a bad time.
You want to wait around till midnight to find out?
Let's see what else we've got.
It might be a calculation of the amount of power he needs to create the hole between the force and the anti-force.
The closest you could come is the New York City Subway System.
Come on. I've found a way down.
Come on, help me with this.
Somehow, I don't think we've seen the last of him.
Spider-Man? You're in love with Spider-Man?
Did the Astro-Physics Journal really accept your paper?
And its influence on the anti-force.
Yeah, you and the rest of the class.
Ock is nuts, don't you agree?
Can I be your date for the reunion ShooShoo?
Wrestling is all bluff. Do you really believe this little guy in a stupid Spider-Man suit beat the Crusher?
You should have worn a costume. I told you to wear a costume.
Anyway, who'll be sitting with you at the Halloween Ball?
I went to the wrestling, wanted to see that Amazing Spider-Man, but he didn't show up.
I can try. I could access the system in the dorm. Okay. And through that I could crack the main line.
Let me see. It's some kind of countdown clock.
I don't know, but whatever it is, it's only six hours away.
That's a lot of energy. What could generate power like that?
Our University has the biggest center in town.
Yes, but where the hell is he?
And Professor Rosomorf and crazy Ock.
No, but I bet Spider-Man is.
The Slammies??? I'd kill for that!!!
Will you look at this Spider-Man guy! He is absolutely incredible!
Holy jumping jelly beans, willya look at these pictures of Spider-Man? Wow! Is this guy great or what?
Hey, they won't let up, man!
Hey, where'd he go? Hey, Spider-Man!!
Take your shoes for a walk, Dork.
What does he want with toxic waste?
Hey, look at this. Empire State University. This is our cyclotron, right?
We must find Peter, he knows these computers better than all of us.
What about Peter? Is he there with them?
Doctor Octavius! You are late for your lecture. The students are waiting.
Peter Parker's data on the Planetary Conjunction. Damn lucky I hid it in my computer under another title.
That's him again. He's working day and night.
Please, Otto, we must lock it up.
Take it easy. Take it easy with him.
You're going to be fine, Otto.
Nothing beyond what I read in the papers.
You boys must have had an extraordinary classroom experience.
Don't lose your energy screaming. Catch this rope and climb up, come on!
I've been through the Octavius data. He has enough power with his Plutonium.
It is cosmic suicide! You have no right!
Your friend is impossible Professor Rosomorf, I told the board we should let him go.
What's he doing in there, not his crazy experiment again.
Meanwhile he is demolishing our university. Octavius!!
Tell your boss, that his class is waiting.
The university pays you to teach something to your students.
Keep calm, everybody keep calm. Use the front door. Everybody out the front.
Get back, you idiots. You can't go in there!
This man will bring a disaster upon this university.
My God, what's going on in our school?
Rosomorf, the man is a very dangerous crackpot!
I tell you the man is very dangerous.
Come on Rosomorf, let's stop him before this building will explode.
You've blown half the circuits in the Science Center.
We have to shut your lab down and take a look at the lines.
There is no danger. Please go back to your dorms. I repeat, there is no danger.
Take him away and never bring him back!
I don't know. It was so fast.
Octavius, I'm afraid I have bad news for you.
What used to be the cyclotron was permanently shut down this afternoon.
Your work is a disaster! Look at yourself!
Oh, my God, what are those horrible things sticking from your body?
What on Earth are you rambling about?
I got one! I got one!
Bag ladies. I hate bag ladies.
Kid? You want a pro's assessment?

Parker, my readers are morons. I gotta grab them by the eyes. Every time you press the button of that Nikon of yours it costs you fifty-five cents. So the next time you're about to take the plunge, ask yourself, am I taking dog bites man?
Parker, this is the post modern 20th century. I want man eats dog! Get out!
Spill it out, Professor! The public wants to know!
Jameson, Daily Bugle, Chief Editor, now what really happened here?
That's for them to know, and for you to find out.
A hundred dollars says you can?
Get inside and get pictures, fifty bucks.
Seventy, but I want blood and gore.
Good job, kid. Bizarre is what we need.
I don't care if he flies to the moon.
Now get out of here and don't come back without something I can use!
Parker? Peter Parker? This is J. Jonah Jameson!
I need pictures of your friend, the Amazing Spider-Man. But I need bad guy shots, you got it? Lots of bad guy shots.
What about that kid? On the job already?
That's the understatement of the year.
But I didn't feel like getting to know your roaches.
Yes. Do you have a date?
Yah! Way to do it. Alright!
You don't follow the Mets like you used to, do you, Pete?
Look, just leave him alone, okay. When he's ready for girls he'll be a holy terror.
Lookit, how are you fixed for money, Pete? Maybe I can help you out a little.
What a bunch of crap. Goddamn rock and roll's screwed up the whole TV.
Come on, May. Wake up and go to sleep.
Oh, I'll go look. Go back to sleep.
Let go before I blow your brain's out.
It's on the table! Turn off the TV!
How's that girl you told us about, Peter?
A boy your age should have a girlfriend.
Peter? What time is it? Are you alright?
Does this have to do with a certain girl we talked about at dinner?
Oh! I get it, you mean a love bug.
Peter, did you at least talk to her?
Oh, you did it in the bathroom? Peter, this is craziness, why don't you use your bed? You're up all night. You're in the radioactive labs. You never take time to eat or sleep. Am I right?
Okay, Peter go back to bed, and remember we love you.
You're as lovely as Peter said you were.
Tell me about Peter. What's he been up to? He seems so preoccupied.
When Peter was little, he loved to hide.
That's what I used to say to Peter when I found him.
Hey! What are you doing here, kid?
You get yourself over to the Police lines.
You're a kid who's going places, and I'm gonna point you the right way.
It's a big outfit. Got a lot of departments.
You invest half of that with me and I'll make you a star.
I'm talking about fame. I'm talking about fortune. I'm talking about the chance of a lifetime. How'd you like to be on MTV tomorrow night?
Kid! Tomorrow night. Same place, same time.
That's the place. Pay the man.
Who said anything about watching a wrestling match? You're here to win a wrestling match!
You hop around. You know, the way you did last night. Your opponent gets tired.
You don't have to know. I know enough for both of us.
Cover your face with the mask.
We are going to get a thousand--
Okay, lets stop yakking and get cracking.
Mop. Mop! Sutures and clamps! Hurry up!
She's alright. She just fainted. We'll have to check her for symptoms of shock.
Whatsamatter, Crusher, can't you crush that bug?
Hey, Crusher, you need a insecticide!
Okay, Web Face, this is it!
Ladies and Gentlemen, history is made today, we have here the first man to win a thousand dollars against the mighty Crusher.
And tell the Professor he can't have Peter's data. Goodbye.
Hey! Can't you go any faster?
Look, I'm really in a hurry.
I know what's happening to you, Ock.
I'm a good friend of Peter Parker's Ock.
Give it up, Professor. You'll never catch me!
I better just take you back where you belong.
Liz, listen to me. There's something I have to tell you.
Do you know who I am?
And that's all you know about me?
How many do you have? I meant Flash.
Thanks, but I have some business to take care of.
Peter Parker told me all about it.
Okay, everyone, stand back and stay cool.
Somebody wanna give me a hand with this?
Sure thing, just don't take the train.
Let's get you out of here first, Professor.
Hey, you big OCK, why don't you pick on someone your own size?!
Hey, driver. Could you follow that red Vette for me?
You any good with this thing?
New Jersey has the largest toxic waste dump in the world.
Try to stay with me. I don't want to lose him!
Open that now, and you'll spoil Christmas.
Okay now, Spidey. Easy does it.
Don't give up, Spidey. Don't give up.
Well, so far so good. But I can't hold on much longer.
Stop the car. I have an idea.
It's started. Step on it Professor, or we'll never make it.
Don't listen to him Professor Roz.
I think we have to pull some of these cables. Try those over there. I'll work on these. We gotta slow this thing down somehow. We got helicopters coming.
Alright, keep moving, a step at a time!
Go ahead. It's easier than it looks!
Holy cow, whattaya building, fella, a cyclotron?
Thank you, thank you. We have a special surprise guest tonight.
Some crazy kinda town, huh? You hear about that hold-up? The guy with the six arms? Hey, I see it all on this job.
What kinda outfit is that, anyway?
You said the magic words, we have a flat Boychick.
Hey! You wanna hand me that lug wrench?
Your uncle's a brave man. Apparently, the perpetrator was after something of yours. Your uncle didn't know what it was but he stood up to him anyway. You ought to be proud of him.
Look, if it makes you feel any better.
Mrs. Parker, I'm sorry. We tried.
This is your last chance, you two.
You have thirty seconds to come out!
And you're looking at twenty years.
What are you doing here? Get out of here!
Hey, what are you talking about?!
What's the matter, lady don't you read the papers?
Come on. Come on. That's it. Step lively now.
Gimme more ladder! I need more ladder!
Negative on that, you're at full extension!
